nodes.bodyText: These fields (titleStyle , titlePosition)  are not used inside opfab and will be removed  in a future release
I have removed fhem from the avro files.

The field parentCardUid is now parentCardId
And there is a new field initialParentCardUid
Need to rebase/merge your code with last version
Done. Merged and updated the said fields.
I do not think you need this field has it is readonly and used only by the UI

+  "type": "record",
+  "name": "Card",

nodes.bodyText: I thought it might be used by the response cards. hence left it in the AVRO schema. I now removed the entry.

nodes.bodyText: Why do we not have this properties in this configuration file  and not in cards-publication-docker.yml as in /config/dev configuration . The idea is to have only one way of configuration.

Understood. I removed the properties file and the pointer to it from the cards-publication-docker.yml.
The idea was to have some kind of configuration outside of the docker .yml files.
We now edit the .yml files to suit our environment, but we rather not edit them as we might accidentally check them in.
To be in package org.lfenergy.operatorfabric.cards.publication.configuration.kafka to be consistent with other configuration classes
To be in package org.lfenergy.operatorfabric.cards.publication.configuration.kafka to be consistent with other configuration classes
As said in previous comment , it is perferrable to use only one way of configuration (the yml file)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,116 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2018-2020 RTE (http://www.rte-france.com)
+// See AUTHORS.txt
+// This document is subject to the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license.
+// If a copy of the license was not distributed with this
+// file, You can obtain one at https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/.
+// SPDX-License-Identifier: CC-BY-4.0
+
+:kafka_schema: https://docs.confluent.io/current/schema-registry/index.html
+:confluent: https://www.confluent.io/
+:spring_kafka_doc: https://docs.spring.io/spring-kafka/reference/html/
+
+= Kafka Implementation
+
+Next to publishing cards to OperatorFabric using the REST API, OperatorFabric also supports publishing cards via a Kafka Topic.
+In the default configuration Kafka is disabled.
+
+== Enabling Kafka
+
+To enable Kafka support you need to set the `kafka.consumer.group_id property` in the cards-publication yml file:
+[source,yaml]
+----
+  kafka:
+    consumer:
+      group-id: opfab-command
+----
+
+Alternatively you can set the group id in the `config/docker/kafka-env.properties` file:
+[source, shell]
+----
+SPRING_KAFKA_CONSUMER_GROUP_ID=opfab-command
+----
+The default topic from which the messages are consumed is called 'opfab'. This setting can be modified by setting 'opfab.kafka.topics.topicname '.
+
